index – The index of the desired control input within the control vector

index – The index of the state being requested

Returns:

NDArray[Any]

get_time_vec() → ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]]¶

Returns the vector of valid time values from the initial time to the current time

class py_sim.tools.sim_types.DwaParams(v_des: float, w_max: float, w_res: float, ds: float, sf: float, s_eps: float, k_v: float, sigma: float, v_res: float, classic: bool)¶

Bases: object

Parameters used for following a carrot point using the dynamic window approach

v_des¶

The desired translational velocity

Type:

float

w_vals¶

The desired rotational velocities to search

Type:

list(float)

t_vals¶

The time instances to evaluate on each arc

Type:

list(float)

dt¶

The resolution in time for each sample

Type:

float

ds¶

The spatial resolution for each sample (meters)

Type:

float

tf¶

The final time to evaluate

Type:

float

k_v¶

The cost scaling for velocity

Type:

float

sigma¶

Width parameter for the distance-based velocity scaling

Type:

float

v_res¶

The resolution in velocity for each sample when run the classic DWA

Type:

float

classic¶

True if the classic DWA is being run

Type:

bool

t_eps¶

A small value in time to subtract from a collision point

Type:

float

_w_vals¶

The desired rotational velocities to search (internal)

Type:

list(float)

_w_max¶

The maximum angular velocity to search

Type:

float

_w_res¶

The resolution of the arc search. Arc searched from -w_max:w_res:w_max

Type:

float

property w_vals: list[float]¶

Returns the rotational velocity list

class py_sim.tools.sim_types.EllipseParameters(a: float = 0.0, b: float = 0.0, center: ~py_sim.tools.sim_types.TwoDimArray = <py_sim.tools.sim_types.TwoDimArray object>, alpha: float = 0.0)¶

Bases: object

Defines the parameters necessary for defining an ellipse

a¶

Major axis radius

b¶

Minor axis radius

center¶

Center point of the ellipse

alpha¶

orientation from x-axis of ellipse

c_a¶

the cosine of alpha

s_a¶

the sine of alpha

property alpha: float¶

Return the alpha component

property c_a: float¶

Returns the cosine of alpha

property s_a: float¶

Returns the sine of alpha

contains(state: TwoDimArray) → bool¶

Evaluates if the state is in the state space. Returns true if it is

Parameters:

state – State to be evaluated

Returns:

True if the state is in the state space, false otherwise

Return type:

bool

class py_sim.tools.sim_types.VectorField(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Protocol

Defines the functions needed for a vector field class

calculate_vector(state: TwoDArrayType, time: float) → TwoDimArray¶

Calculates a vector given the time and unicycle state

Parameters:

  • state – Current position and orientation

  • time – time in question (seconds)

Returns:

The resulting vector

Return type:

TwoDimArray
